p: In order to test the CRVA methodology three countries have been selected: Vietnam, Uganda and Nicaragua. Both Vietnam (7th) and Nicaragua (4) have been placed in the top 10 most affected countries [ 36] to climate risks over the past two decades (1994â€“2013). Uganda, a low income [ 37] landlocked country located in Sub Saharan Africa, has also been identified as a country highly vulnerable to climate change [ 6, 38, 39]. All three countries have a substantial agricultural sector; as of 2016 agriculture comprised 16.3% of GDP and employed 48% of the labour force in Vietnam [ 40], in Nicaragua 15% of GDP is attributed to agriculture and employs 31% of the labour force [ 41], and in Uganda 25% of GDP is derived from agriculture, and 72% of the labour force are employed in agriculture [ 42].
